title: HARRY POTTER WANTED POSTER
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418235105im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ADVICEWANTED_4152.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418235105im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wanted_4870.gif)

I purchased both [Grotesque Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418235105/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/grotesque/) by Wooden Type Fonts and [Rama Gothic Exp Heavy](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418235105/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/rama-gothic/) by Flat-it, top suggestions by Find-My-Font, but it isn't either one.

Any idea?
author: tatesha

comments.content: I didn't yet find a match, but, looking at the scratches on the same letters, I can tell that the font used was already distressed.

Too compressed but very similar effect: Headlined [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/thinkdust/headlined/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418235105/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/thinkdust/headlined/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/thinkdust/headlined/")  
Don

Perhaps a little too battered; Mr. Black [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hipopotam/mr-black/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418235105/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hipopotam/mr-black/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hipopotam/mr-black/")  
Don

Dafont has a big selection of "eroded" fonts [http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=107&fpp=100&text=ADVICE+WANTED](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418235105/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=107&fpp=100&text=ADVICE+WANTED "http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=107&fpp=100&text=ADVICE+WANTED")  
Perhaps one might work as a substitute.  
No guarantee as to the legitimacy of these fonts. Some are based on rips of digital fonts created by other fontmakers, which are then eroded or otherwise abused. But there is some interesting original amateur work.  
Don

Another likely source: [http://www.waldenfont.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418235105/http:/www.waldenfont.com/ "http://www.waldenfont.com/") (same disclaimer Don gave on Dafont applies here).

I have begun to think it is an exremely modified version of GrotRough by Steve Kettell  
 [http://www.dafont.com/grotrough.font?text=ADVICE+WANTED&fpp=100&psize=l&...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418235105/http:/www.dafont.com/grotrough.font?text=ADVICE+WANTED&fpp=100&psize=l&back=author "http://www.dafont.com/grotrough.font?text=ADVICE+WANTED&fpp=100&psize=l&back=author")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418235105im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ADVICEWANTED_6404.gif)
  
Distortion in the example above isn't right, however I'm still working on it :)  
I have written to Warner Bros. asking for help. I am hoping they will reply and be able to answer lynnyuxin in his post [http://typophile.com/node/121014](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418235105/http:/typophile.com/node/121014 "http://typophile.com/node/121014") as well.

Thanks all.
